decks.notes: The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. By utilizing powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, as well as synergistic cards like Counterbalance and Predict, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish dominance over the game. Additionally, the deck runs a suite of versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment to deal with threats efficiently.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions with cards like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The main goal is to manage the board state and outvalue the opponent through efficient card draw and selection, eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats and control elements to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of land destruction, graveyard recursion, and powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Wasteland, Life from the Loam, and Knight of the Reliquary, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base while maintaining a solid board presence. Additionally, cards like Liliana of the Veil and Chalice of the Void help to control the opponent's hand and spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outgrind the opponent through resource denial and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana rocks, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up to a lethal Tendrils of Agony or generate a large army of tokens with Empty the Warrens. The deck also includes cards like Gitaxian Probe, Duress, and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo. The goal is to win the game in a single explosive turn, utilizing the storm mechanic to chain spells together for a powerful finish.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Fatal Push, and Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to gain card advantage and control the game. Additionally, the deck includes versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix, along with efficient mana sources like Deathrite Shaman to outvalue the opponent and control the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through disrupting opponents' strategies with counterspells and removal spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. It also utilizes powerful equipments like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to further control the board and gain an advantage. The deck has a strong finisher in True-Name Nemesis, supported by Stoneforge Mystic and Snapcaster Mage to search for and reuse key cards. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and can help lock down opponents. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and out-control opponents to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality. The combo aspect comes into play with using Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible creature in just a few turns. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Iona, Shield of Emeria, Griselbrand, and Grave Titan, while using cards like Animate Dead and Lake of the Dead to bring them back from the graveyard.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Gitaxian Probe, then bring them back to the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Exhume. The deck also utilizes combo pieces like Phyrexian Devourer, Triskelion, and Griselbrand to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Cabal Therapy and Collective Brutality help disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing additional graveyard fuel. With a strong mix of fast mana, card draw, and powerful reanimation spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-impact threats.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to play aggressively and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With a mix of powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler, coupled with disruptive spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, Daze, and Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as mana denial with Wasteland, allows the deck to maintain consistency and disrupt the opponent's strategy effectively.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board with various counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers while also utilizing powerful card draw and manipulation effects like Brainstorm and Search for Azcanta. Humility and Engineered Explosives help to neutralize threats on the board, while the planeswalkers provide additional win conditions. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage, disrupting their game plan, and ultimately stabilizing the board to take over the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to out-value the opponent. By disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and countering key spells with Force of Will, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can win with efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Tombstalker. The mana base is designed to support the deck's Grixis color combination and provide access to a variety of powerful spells.

The deck focuses on rapidly filling the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Breakthrough in order to trigger powerful graveyard-based effects such as Ichorid, Narcomoeba, and Bridge from Below. This allows the player to create a massive zombie army and overwhelm the opponent in a quick and efficient manner. With cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy to further disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to combo off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells, card advantage, and disruption elements such as counterspells and discard spells to control the game and grind out incremental advantages over the opponent. It also incorporates powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to close out games once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the efficiency of its spells, allowing the player to dictate the pace and flow of the game.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through Cloudpost and Eldrazi Temples to cast high-cost Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog, Kozilek, and Emrakul. It also utilizes ramp cards like Thran Dynamo and Grim Monolith to accelerate the process. The inclusion of cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Voltaic Key can untap artifacts for additional mana. The deck aims to establish a powerful board presence early to overwhelm the opponent with its massive Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays with Eldrazi creatures and disruption with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Endbringer while controlling the board with cards like Dismember and All Is Dust. The mana base is designed to maximize the casting of Eldrazi creatures and provide versatility with cards like Ancient Tomb and Wasteland. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around playing big threats early and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this Jund Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay. Liliana of the Veil and Kolaghan's Command provide additional disruption and value. The mana base is designed to consistently provide the necessary black, red, and green mana for the deck's spells. Ultimately, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive threats and disruption.
